channel.title: Irske sanges on Unghanekorets sangsamling
channel.description: Recent content in Irske sanges on Unghanekorets sangsamling

item.title: All For Me Grog
item.description: The Dubliners, 1967 Noter: G-dur, 2 og 2 skiftes til at synge 1 vers Omkvæd And it’s all for me grog Me jolly, jolly grog All for my beer and tobacco Well, I spent all me tin With the ladies drinkin' gin Far across the Western Ocean I must wander 1. I’m sick in the head And I haven’t been to bed Since first I came ashore with me plunder

item.title: Black Velvet Band
item.description: The Irish Rovers, 1971 (The Unicorn) 1. In a neat little town they called Belfast Apprentice to trade I was bound And many an hour sweet happiness I spent in that neat little town ‘Til bad misfortune came o’er me That caused me to stray from the land Far away from me friends and relations To follow the black velvet band Omkvæd Her eyes they shone like the diamonds

item.title: Galway Girl
item.description: Steve Earl, 2000 Noter: F-dur, trestemmigt i omkvæd (TMB), vi skal være meget rytmiske og gerne gå i takt på stedet 1. I took a stroll on the old long walk Of a day -I-ay-I-ay I met a little girl and we stopped to talk Of a fine soft day -I-ay Omkvæd x 2 And I ask you, friend, what’s a fella to do ‘Cause her hair was black and her eyes were blue

item.title: I’ll Tell Me Ma
item.description: Tekst og melodi: Ukendt Noter: F-dur, trestemmigt omkvæd (TMB) Bro I’ll tell me Ma when I go home, The boy’s won’t leave the girls alone. They’ll pull my hair, they stole my comb, Well that’s alright till I go home. Omkvæd She is handsome. She is pretty. She is the bell of Dublin City. She is courtin' one, two, three. Please won’t you tell me, who is she? 1.

item.title: Molly Malone
item.description: Oprindelse: muligvis 1700-tallet Indspillet: måske 1876 Noter: F-dur, trestemmigt i omkvæd (TMB) 1. In Dublin’s fair city, Where the girls are so pretty, I first set my eyes on sweet Molly Malone, As she wheeled her wheel-barrow, Through streets broad and narrow, Crying, “Cockles and mussels, alive, alive, oh!" Omkvæd Alive, alive, oh, Alive, alive, oh, Crying “cockles and mussels, alive, alive, oh” Omkvæd Alive, alive, oh, Alive, alive, oh,

item.title: Seven Drunken Nights
item.description: Folkemelodi Gjort populært af The Dubliners, 1967 Noter: D-dur 1. As I went home on Monday night as drunk as drunk could be I saw a horse outside the door where my old horse should be Well, I called me wife and said to her: Will you kindly tell to me Who owns that horse outside the door where my old horse should be? Omkvæd Ah, you’re drunk, you’re drunk you silly old fool,
